question_sentence: Which high-profile Republican announced a 2024 White House bid this week?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump announced that he will run for president in 2024. He is widely expected to be challenged by both conservative and moderate Republicans who could announce their campaigns in the coming months.

question_sentence: Around 800 people on board a cruise ship recently tested positive for which virus?
evidence: A major Covid-19 outbreak on Carnival’s Majestic Princess prompted its operators to dock in Sydney, Australia, to allow hundreds of people off the ship. Those who tested positive were advised to complete a five-day isolation period.

question_sentence: Elon Musk appeared in court this week to defend the compensation package he received as Tesla’s CEO. How much is his pay package worth?
evidence: The net value of Elon Musk’s compensation package as the CEO of Tesla is $51 billion, making it the biggest for anyone on Earth from a publicly traded company.

question_sentence: Regulators hit six airlines with millions in fines for delayed refunds to passengers during the Covid-19 pandemic. Which is the only US airline to face the fines?
evidence: Ultra low-cost carrier Frontier Airlines is the only US airline to face fines related to refunds. Carriers based in other countries face the majority of fines: Air India, TAP Portugal, Aeromexico, El Al and Avianca.

question_sentence: Republicans will win the House of Representatives, CNN projects. How many seats were needed to gain control of the chamber?
evidence: The GOP passed the threshold of 218 seats needed for control of the chamber eight days after Election Day.

question_sentence: NASA launched its historic Artemis I mission on Wednesday. Where is the uncrewed spacecraft headed?
evidence: The Artemis I mission is paving the way for NASA to return astronauts to the moon for the first time in 50 years.

question_sentence: A federal judge recently moved to block a rule that allowed US authorities to expel more than a million migrants at the US-Mexico border. What is the rule called?
evidence: A judge issued an order blocking Title 42, a controversial Trump-era border policy. President Joe Biden, however, has requested a stay on the ruling, which will now be on hold until December 21.

question_sentence: World leaders are attempting to defuse a potential escalation in the monthslong Ukraine war after a Russian-made missile landed in which NATO country this week?
evidence: The missile that landed in Poland this week was likely fired by Ukrainian forces defending their country against a barrage of Russian strikes, Polish and NATO officials said, adding the incident appeared to be an accident. The event marked the first time a NATO country has been directly hit during the conflict.

question_sentence: The world’s population reached a new milestone this week. Approximately how many people now live on Earth?
evidence: The world’s population has reached 8 billion people, according to a projection from the UN. “This unprecedented growth is due to the gradual increase in human lifespan owing to improvements in public health, nutrition, personal hygiene and medicine. It is also the result of high and persistent levels of fertility in some countries,” the UN said.

question_sentence: A ferocious lake-effect snowstorm took aim at which state this week?
evidence: Excessive snowfall in and around Buffalo and Watertown, New York, was expected to shut down roads and paralyze cities for days, the National Weather Service said on Thursday.

question_sentence: Nancy Pelosi announced on Thursday that she would be stepping down from Speaker of the House. When did Pelosi first become speaker?
Millions of fans (and bots) flooded Ticketmaster's presale for Taylor Swift's next tour, causing the website to crash. What is the tour called?
Thousands of Starbucks workers went on strike on one of the company's busiest days of the year. The walkout coincided with which promotion?
It took eight days past Election Day, but control of the House of Representatives was finally decided. Which party secured the majority?
Beyoncé racked up 9 Grammy Award nods this week, bringing her total to 88. Which artist does she tie with for the most Grammy nominations ever?
This former Seahawks and 49ers cornerback is now an essential studio analyst on Amazon Prime Video’s Thursday Night Football.
Vandals destroyed fencing at a fur farm in northwest Ohio this week, releasing what from their cages?
Donald Trump announced he will run for president in 2024. Legal experts say being a candidate does not protect Trump from criminal prosecution.
Actress Christina Applegate received her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame this week. On which '90s sitcom did she star as Kelly Bundy?
Disney World is raising ticket prices for the first time since 2019. How much did adult admission cost when the Magic Kingdom opened in 1971?
Egypt has hosted Cop27 but where is the annual climate summit to be held next year?
evidence: The UN’s next Climate Change Conference (Cop28) is due to take place in Dubai from 30 November to 12 December 2023

question_sentence: Which music star has lost a bid to become officially recognised as the ‘Queen of Christmas’?
evidence: The US Patent and Trademark Office rejected the singer’s application after her company did not respond to another artist’s opposition. Elizabeth Chan, who specialises in festive music, launched a legal bid to block the trademark in August

question_sentence: Scientists studying the structure of neutron stars have compared the celestial objects to which sweet treats?
evidence: Researchers at Goethe University in Frankfurt made the comparison to the chocolate pralines after using hundreds of thousands of equations to define the stars’ structure from the stellar surface to the inner core

question_sentence: Which of Donald Trump’s children has said they do not want to be involved in his 2024 presidential bid?
evidence: Ivanka was a top White House advisor during her father’s time as president, but she ‘would never go back to that life’, a source close to the family reportedly told CNN

question_sentence: Which staple of the full English breakfast is being rationed in some UK supermarkets and pubs?
evidence: With bird flu and soaring production costs causing supply problems, eggs have been removed from fry-ups in a number of Wetherspoon pubs. Supermarkets including Asda and Lidl are putting limits on how many eggs customers can buy

question_sentence: Which top Tory this week requested an independent investigation into bullying allegations against them?
evidence: Deputy Prime Minister Raab wrote to Rishi Sunak asking for an independent inquiry into himself after being accused of aggressive behaviour towards staff during his reigns at the Foreign Office and the Ministry of Justice

question_sentence: According to the UN, the world’s population reached how many billion this week?
evidence: The global population reached an estimated 8bn on 15 November and is projected to climb to 9.7bn by 2050

question_sentence: Which of the following social media platforms reportedly gained 70,000 users overnight after Elon Musk’s controversial Twitter takeover?
evidence: Fed-up former tweeters have been flocking to Twitter rivals including Mastodon, which is billed as ‘a network of millions of users in independent communities that can all interact with one another’

question_sentence: What percentage of British voters now think the UK was right to leave the EU, according to a new YouGov poll?
evidence: The survey of more than 1,700 people found that 56% now think Britain was wrong the quit the bloc, while 13% were undecided

question_sentence: Cases of gonorrhoea and chlamydia in England are rising quickest among which age group, according to a new report?
evidence: A newly published Local Government Association report said that the number of over-65s who caught common STIs rose from 2,280 in 2017 to 2,748 in 2019, an increase of 20%
